moves.1... e5: At this level this is the common response.
moves.2. Nf3 Nc6 3. Bc4 Nd4 4. Nxe5: I didn't see any reason not to take the pawn, so...
moves.4... f6: Decided to poke my knight. Guess he didn't notice the fork
moves.5. Nf7 Qe7 6. Nxh8 Qxe4+: Forking my king and G pawn
moves.7. Be2: Seemed best to me. Although blocking with the queen might have been better.
moves.8. Rf1: Had to be careful of smothered mate here if pins my bishop
moves.13... b6: Probably trying to fianchetto. (Is that how you spell it?)
moves.14. Be3 Qb4+: Another fork between my king and a pawn.
moves.16. Qh5+ g6 17. Qxh7: I thought that if he took my rook I could checkmate him. I guess I didn't notice it would put me in check
moves.17... Qxa1+ 18. Ke2: Now the queen is attacked and I though he would have to either lose his queen or the game. But he noticed something...
moves.18... Qxa2 19. Qxg6+: Here I decided a draw was good enough and calculated that I could get perpetual check. If you notice something he could have done to get out of it, please tell me.
moves.19... Kd8 20. Nf7+ Ke8 21. Nh8+: Here he had to options. One led to perpetual check, (I think) the other led to checkmate.
moves.22. Bh6#: And a nice bishop checkmate to finish.
